Class PersonRecord

java.lang.Object
  PersonRecord

public class PersonRecord
extends java.lang.Object

This application provides an AddressBook functionality, permitting the user to add information about individuals, save the information and retrieve it later.

Version:
1.0.0.0, March 4 2014
Author:
Horatiu Lazu

nameCheck

private java.lang.String nameCheck(java.lang.String data)
This method verifies the name, and returns a String with the proper name (capitalization). The while loop ensures that the processing occurs for every single word within the input. The if statement then verifies it the first letter of the word must be capitalized.

Parameters:
data - String, used to representing the feeding data.
st - StringTokenizer reference, used to split the information into sentences.
temp - String, used to process the temporary token.
Returns:
String, used to return the fixed name.

phoneFormat

private java.lang.String phoneFormat(java.lang.String data)
This method will sort the phone number accordingly. The if statement works such that if the length is not 10 then it will return -1 which will be an error number. The if statement works such that it will only add the character if it's not a space or a dash - in a for loop to go through each index.

Parameters:
data - String, used to input the current phone number.
temp - String, used to add the final output String.
e - NumberFormatException in case the input is not a number.
Throws:
NumberFormatException, - used to verify if the input is a number.
